original_title: Sri Lanka power tariff cut proposal to CEB board after El Niño deluge
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A plan to cut Sri Lanka’s electricity tariffs would be submitted to the Board of Directors on later on January 09, Minister of Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said after strong rainfall reduced costs.
After approval by the board the tariff cut proposal would be submitted to the Public Utility Commission.
The regulator will give a decision after a public hearing, he said.
Sri Lanka has got record inter-monsoonal rain in 2023, a phenomenon that is seen in so-called El El Niño years.
Sri Lanka also sees bumper rice harvest in El El Niño years in the main Maha cropping season after the year end rains which is when paddy is sowed.

However the first quarter of the following year tends to be dry. (Colombo/Jan09/2023)
